p: There are plant-based sources of ALA: flaxseeds, hemp seeds, chia seeds, leafy green vegetables (both terrestrial and marine), walnuts, and wheat germ, as well as their derived oils [ 74, 84]. However, due to the inefficient conversion of ALA to EPA and DHA, alternative sources are needed in plant-based diets. For this purpose, cultured microalgae, through which fish acquire them, nowadays represent a growing market [ 58, 80] ( Table 2).
